data.title: Rounding problems
data.statement:
Do you know how to round a number to the closest integer ?
Of course you do, but your best friend doesn't. If there are more than one decimal place, he rounds each decimal place until the number becomes an integer.

Sometimes it works (2.681 => 2.68 => 2.7 => 3), and sometimes it doesn't (3.492 => 3.49 => 3.5 => 4).

Given a list of floating points numbers with 3 decimal places, you have to write for each one if the successive rounding works (and output {{OK}}) or not ({{NOK}}).

<<Expected roundings:>>
0.005 => 0.01
0.05 => 0.1
0.5 => 1
-0.005 => -0.01
-0.05 => -0.1
-0.5 => -1

data.constraints:
2 <= [[n]] <= 100
-100 <= [[fi]] <= 100
Every [[fi]] is written with 3 decimal places
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read f:float
write OK or NOK
data.inputDescription:
<<First line:>> the number [[n]] of numbers [[f1]], [[f2]] ... [[fi]] to round
<<[[n]] following lines:>> the numbers [[fi]] to round

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Do you know how to round a number to the closest integer ?
Of course you do, but your best friend doesn't. If there are more than one decimal place, he rounds each decimal place until the number becomes an integer.

Sometimes it works (2.681 => 2.68 => 2.7 => 3), and sometimes it doesn't (3.492 => 3.49 => 3.5 => 4).

Given a list of floating points numbers with 3 decimal places, you have to write for each one if the successive rounding works (and output OK) or not (NOK).

Expected roundings:
0.005 => 0.01
0.05 => 0.1
0.5 => 1
-0.005 => -0.01
-0.05 => -0.1
-0.5 => -1
Input
First line: the number n of numbers f1, f2 ... fi to round
n following lines: the numbers fi to round
Output
n lines containing OK or NOK
Constraints
2 <= n <= 100
-100 <= fi <= 100
Every fi is written with 3 decimal places
Example
Input
2
2.681
3.492
Output
OK
NOK
